alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 PM EDT, The gauge along the Rocky River near Irish Buffalo has crested at 16 feet and continues to fall slowly. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - Flooding along Back Creek south of Harrisburg may occur near the intersection of Robinson Church Road and Stallings Road which is near Middleton and Rocky Meadows subdivisions. Flooding from Back Creek may affect Pharr Mill Road, Stallings Road, and Mount Pleasant Road due to backwater effects from Rocky River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
